name: HD 102195
scenarioDescription:
The HD 102195 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 102195 is a star with 0.76 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.82 times its radius. It is located 95.76 light years away from the solar system.

HD 102195 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 102195 system


HD 102195 b

HD 102195 b was discovered by the Kitt Peak National Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 102195 b is 130.38 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 102195 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 102195, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Kitt Peak National Observatory.
